us.phonetic: /n., adj. ˈsʌbdʒɪkt; v. səbˈdʒɛkt/, (n., adj. sub′jikt; v. səb jekt′)

example.eg: What is the subject of that book?
I am studying three subjects: Chemistry, English and French.
example.egtrans: 我正在学三门课：化学、英语和法语。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 学科, 科目, 课程

example.eg: The subject usually comes before the verb in English.
example.egtrans: 英语中主语往往在动词之前。

example.eg: The police subjected the suspect to an intense interrogation.
example.egtrans: 警方对嫌疑人进行了高强度的审讯。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 使某人经受, 使某人遭受, 对某人进行

example.eg: All new policies are subject to the boss's approval.
example.egtrans: 所有新政策的出台都听令于老板的批准。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 受…支配的, 听令于…的

example.eg: This schedule is subject to last minute changes.
example.egtrans: 这份时间表有可能在最后一分钟发生改动。

example.eg: The politicians are subject to the will of the people.
example.egtrans: 政客要服从人民的意志。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 受...管辖的, 受...约束的

us.phonetic: /n., adj. ˈsʌbdʒɪkt; v. səbˈdʒɛkt/, (n., adj. sub′jikt; v. səb jekt′)

example.eg: Historians are studying the influence of subject peoples on the nations that ruled them.
example.egtrans: 历史学家们正在研究受统治的人民对于统治自身的国家的影响。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 受统治的, 统治下的

dsense.name: subject
dsense.guideword: (in a clinical trial, patient) (临床试验)

example.eg: The subject tried to stay still while the doctors looked at him.
example.egtrans: 当医生注视自己的时候，受检者努力保持不动。

example.eg: The pathologist examined the subject carefully.
example.egtrans: 病理学家仔细地检查着供解剖的尸体。

example.eg: Students, please examine the subject and tell me what you think.
example.egtrans: 同学们，请仔细检查主体，然后告诉我你们的想法。

dsense.name: subject
dsense.guideword: (person ruled by a king) (国王、君主的)

example.eg: The English are subjects of their queen.
example.egtrans: 英国人民是他们女王的臣民。

dsense.name: subject
dsense.guideword: (first term of a logical proposition) (逻辑命题)

example.eg: The first term of a proposition is usually called the subject.

dsense.name: subject
dsense.guideword: (heading in memos, email, etc.) (电子邮件等的)

example.eg: Subject: next week's board meeting
One-third of subjects reported headaches after taking the medication.
example.egtrans: 服用药物后，三分之一的受试者报告有头痛反应。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 受试者，实验对象，研究对象

example.eg: The country was subjected to the rule of emperors for several centuries.

us.phonetic: /n., adj. ˈsʌbdʒɪkt; v. səbˈdʒɛkt/, (n., adj. sub′jikt; v. səb jekt′)

example.eg: The marriage laws are subject to change.
Let's change the subject and talk about something less depressing.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 核心学科, 核心科目
主修课程, 主干科目

example.eg: She's doing Spanish at University but her main subject is Psychology.
The main subject of our meeting is the proposed change in office location.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 提及的问题, 正在讨论的问题

dsense.name: subject line
dsense.guideword: (e-mail, internet forum: message heading) (电子邮件、论坛)

example.eg: The subject matter of today's lecture is water pollution.
example.egtrans: 今天讲座的主题是水污染。

example.eg: This painter chooses unconventional subject matter, such as litter on the sidewalk.
Tour prices are subject to change without notice due to currency fluctuations.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 如有变更，恕不另行通知
